name: Lionsgate Entertainment
title: First Chief AI Officer Establishes AI Leadership in Hollywood Studio

classification.classificationRationale: Appointment of first-ever Chief AI Officer suggests establishing a central governance/enablement function. The mandate to 'provide AI tools to serve creative vision' and 'create efficiencies in production/marketing/distribution' indicates a CoE-style role: setting standards, enabling adoption across functions, not creating separate products. However, data is extremely thin — only a single press mention of the hire with truncated mandate description. Classification could shift with more evidence of actual structure.

description:
Lionsgate Entertainment appointed Kathleen Grace as its first-ever Chief AI Officer in early 2026, signaling the Hollywood studio's formal commitment to AI transformation. The mandate as described focuses on providing AI tools to serve the creative vision of filmmakers while creating efficiencies across production, marketing, and distribution functions.

This C-suite AI appointment follows a pattern seen across industries where organizations create dedicated AI leadership to coordinate adoption. The emphasis on 'serving creative vision' suggests Lionsgate is positioning AI as an enablement function rather than a replacement for creative work — a framing likely intended to navigate the entertainment industry's acute sensitivity around AI and creative labor following recent strikes and ongoing tensions.

layers.label: First Entertainment CAIO Appointment — Kathleen Grace
layers.summary: Kathleen Grace appointed as Lionsgate's first Chief AI Officer, reporting directly to CEO Jon Feltheimer and part of senior management team. Collaborates with Vice Chairman Michael Burns. Role spans AI strategy and execution across production, marketing, distribution, and administrative operations, plus IP protection. Grace previously was CSO at Vermillio (AI IP licensing platform) and led YouTube's global Spaces initiative. Lionsgate had previously partnered with Runway (September 2024) on a proprietary AI model. CEO Feltheimer: 'Kathleen understands the AI ecosystem from the perspective of creators and IP holders alike.' First entertainment studio CAIO appointment — the dual mandate (serve creative filmmakers AND drive operational efficiency AND protect IP) is a textbook exploration-execution tension.
